Column Comment.0: RESERVE CLASS IDENTIFIER: The reserve classed for identifying the confidencelevel and producing status of the reserve volumes.
Column Comment.1: ABBREVIATION: abbreviated version of the class name.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y or N flag indicating whether this row of data is currentlyeither active/valid (Y) or inactive/invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: RESERVE ENTITY CONFIDENCE TYPE: The level of confidence associated withthis reserve class, such as proven, possible, probable.
Column Comment.4: DEVELOPED INDICATOR: a Y/N flag indicating whether this class is developed. Ifdeveloped = Y, if undeveloped = N. If unknown is NULL.
Column Comment.5: EFFECTIVE DATE: date on which the data in this row came into effect.
Column Comment.6: EXPIRY DATE: Date on which the data in this row of data was no longer in effect.
Column Comment.7: FULL NAME: Full name for this reserve class, such as proven developed, probableundeveloped.
Column Comment.8: OWNER BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: The owner of this reserves class, such as theSPG.
Column Comment.9: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.10: PREFERRED INDICATOR: a Y/N flag indicating that this reserve class is preferredfor current use. Other versions may exist, but not used as a default.
Column Comment.11: PRODUCTION INDICATOR: a Y/N flag indicating whether this classification refers toa producing entity.
Column Comment.12: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.13: SHORT NAME: Short name for the reserve class.
Column Comment.14: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.15: RESERVE ENTITY USE TYPE: Differentiates between reserve classes where theclient
Column Comment.16: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.17: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.18: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.19: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.20: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.21: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.22: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
